channel.title: Editing the stats menu
channel.description: How could i make my stats menu for Easyrsc not have woodcut and a few other things, Like i dont know what Arrays(If im correct), Thanks for looking!

item.title: Editing the stats menu
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

There’s also something in the each player file and template for each skill and exp for them.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing the stats menu
item.dc:creator: @Officer-Ahole Officer-Ahole
item.description:
@Officer-Ahole wrote:

also if you’re going to take the skills out of the client, take them out server-side as well. don’t make the server try and save every stat instead of just the ones you want. i see this every time and its annoying.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing the stats menu
item.dc:creator: @meatstick meatstick
item.description:
@meatstick wrote:

[quote=“Lets PK, post:5, topic:327916”]^^ Thanks but still didnt work.

Edit: Also changed my int 7’s to 6’s since the first is counted at 0?[/quote]
I was marking it so you could understand that it draws 0-8+9, therefor you’re getting the OutOfBoundsException

Read full topic

item.title: Editing the stats menu
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

If your going to be doing it the way your doing it, theres many different places that you need to change the array limit. Theres definetly more than one place that a for loop is used that counts up to 16. I wouldnt be surpriced if you need to tweak some stuff server side cause i bet your server is still sending 16 stats to the client that is, if you didn’t already change it.

Also, the first loop that you didnt understand what it did, its to have the first 9 stats display on the left then the second loop is used to display stat 9-16 on the right.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing the stats menu
item.dc:creator: @Shob Shob
item.description:
@Shob wrote:

Yes Java always counts 0 as 1 (as zero is a number still). Anyways check where the above post is bolded, should be there. Take a look in the player.java where the classes setEXP and load are located, there are some errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing the stats menu
item.dc:creator: @meatstick meatstick
item.description:
@meatstick wrote:

[quote=“Shob, post:2, topic:327916”] for (int l1 = 0; l1 < 9; l1++) {
int i2 = 0xffffff;
if (super.mouseX > i + 3 && super.mouseY >= i1 - 11 && super.mouseY < i1 + 2 && super.mouseX < i + 90) {
i2 = 0xff0000;
k1 = l1;
}
gameGraphics.drawString(skillArray[l1] + “:@yel@” + playerStatCurrent[l1] + “/” + playerStatBase[l1], i + 5, i1, 1, i2);
i2 = 0xffffff;
if (super.mouseX >= i + 90 && super.mouseY >= i1 - 11 && super.mouseY < i1 + 2 && super.mouseX < i + 196) {
i2 = 0xff0000;
k1 = l1 + 9;
}
gameGraphics.drawString(skillArray[l1 + 9] + “:@yel@” + playerStatCurrent[l1 + 9] + “/” + playerStatBase[l1 + 9], (i + c / 2) - 5, i1, 1, i2);
i1 += 13;
}[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Editing the stats menu
item.dc:creator: @Lets_PK Lets PK
item.description:
@Lets_PK wrote:

Hey, i dont really understand the first loop of it, but this is what i have changed…

in mudclient.java

private final String skillArray[] = {"Att", "Def", "Str", "HP", "Range", "Pray", "Mage", "Cooking", "Woodcutting", "Fletching", "Fishing", "Firemaking", "Crafting", "Smithing", "Mining", "Herblaw", "Agility", "Thieving"};

I changed that and the skillarraylong to look like,

private final String skillArray[] = {"Att", "Def", "Str", "HP", "Range", "Pray", "Mage"};

Then i changed,

playerStatExperience = new int[18];

to this,

playerStatExperience = new int[7];

Then changed,

playerStatBase = new int[18];

to this,

playerStatBase = new int[7];

then changed,

playerStatCurrent = new int[18];

to this,

playerStatCurrent = new int[7];

Then in Player.java i changed this,

	private int[] curStat = new int[18];

to this,

	private int[] curStat = new int[7];

then i changed,

	private int[] maxStat = new int[18];

to this,

	private int[] maxStat = new int[7];

then changed,

	private int[] exp = new int[18];

to this,

	private int[] exp = new int[7];

Then i compiled server - everything good.
Cleint compiled but now when i try log in with my EasyRSC client i get this in the server error messages

[Error] java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 7

And this is what is in the command box of the server.bat

Be very nice if someone could help me, thanks for looking.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing the stats menu
item.dc:creator: @Shob Shob
item.description:
@Shob wrote:

Look around here in the mudclient.java. Basically this is just a loop that assigns the values for the skill. You will need to take a look here and change the numbering for the array for which you would like to include.

            for (int l1 = 0; l1 < 9; l1++) {
                int i2 = 0xffffff;
                if (super.mouseX > i + 3 && super.mouseY >= i1 - 11 && super.mouseY < i1 + 2 && super.mouseX < i + 90) {
                    i2 = 0xff0000;
                    k1 = l1;
                }
                gameGraphics.drawString(skillArray[l1] + ":@yel@" + playerStatCurrent[l1] + "/" + playerStatBase[l1], i + 5, i1, 1, i2);
                i2 = 0xffffff;
                if (super.mouseX >= i + 90 && super.mouseY >= i1 - 11 && super.mouseY < i1 + 2 && super.mouseX < i + 196) {
                    i2 = 0xff0000;
                    k1 = l1 + 9;
                }
                gameGraphics.drawString(skillArray[l1 + 9] + ":@yel@" + playerStatCurrent[l1 + 9] + "/" + playerStatBase[l1 + 9], (i + c / 2) - 5, i1, 1, i2);
                i1 += 13;
            }

You will also have to take a look here:

private final String skillArray[] = {"Attack", "Defense", "Strength", "Hits", "Ranged", "Prayer", "Magic", "Cooking", "Woodcut", "Fletching", "Fishing", "Firemaking", "Crafting", "Smithing", "Mining", "Herblaw", "Agility", "Thieving"};

And here

    private final String skillArrayLong[] = {"Attack", "Defense", "Strength", "Hits", "Ranged", "Prayer", "Magic", "Cooking", "Woodcutting", "Fletching", "Fishing", "Firemaking", "Crafting", "Smithing", "Mining", "Herblaw", "Agility", "Thieving"};

and make sure you assign the correct matching numbers.

I am pretty new to java and the RSCD setup but i’m sure this will get you in the right direction.

Read full topic
